text:
Hello guys,

 I was testing the new video embed player integration with Vidyard and I have noticed that the video quality drops drastically on smaller screens. This is a video that I was testing on <https://play.vidyard.com/zL73BZi5fPVU4dh1bhDUiD?v=4.1.2&viral_sharing=0&embed_button=0&hide_playlist=1&color=FFFFFF&playlist_color=FFFFFF&play_button_color=2A2A2A&type=inline&disable_popouts=1> .
even if I change the quality of the video to be the highest, has no effect though. Any suggestions?

Kind Regards
Have you tested if this occurs on different networks? like 3g vs 4g vs wifi? Could be a feature to prevent draining someone’s data on 3g or 4g?
is on a desktop and is embed in a 980px container. So it shouldn't be an internet problem :disappointed:
:disappointed:
since the player is hosted on vidyard I’d try contacting their support. I think they have to do something about it, doubt the HS team can edit the necessary files
so is a vidyard problem, this is a good start

Hi <@U7VHQMEV7> the player does adapt based on buffering, screen size, and user-inputs on quality, but you can force it to play at a fixed level in some cases.  Here's an article that outlines the decision tree and override options: <https://knowledge.vidyard.com/33002-frequently-asked-questions/how-player-resolution-is-selected>

really minor feedback: <https://spin.d.pr/N7jD3C>

“make available in pages” shows for blog templates.
I think what we need to change here it just the copy, since toggling that off makes the blog template unavailable for selecting for blogs in your settings
Thanks for pointing that out!

The UI for deleting a template doesn’t work properly when deleting blog templates.
<https://spin.d.pr/mxzrYi>
the UI states that there are no dependents but that’s actually wrong. So the field shows disabled. I found that there was a blog template using it, and the UI just didn’t show that. Once resolved I could delete it
Thanks for reporting <@U7SL518D6>
eek! <@U7SL518D6> send me a link please
heh well, I would but I deleted the template that had the issue
haha woops, well i can still take a look
thanks!

Should be easy to reproduce:
1. create a new blog template.
2. in blog settings create a new blog assign that blog to use the new template.
3. in design manager try to delete the blog template.
is there any way to change the “this module can be used in these templates” type settings after the initial time?
yep! click on the link below the module name in the right sidebar of the module editor
the link saying like "Page module", etc
ahhhhh
just minor feedback on that UI - it wasn’t obvious atleast to me that was something you could edit right there. I thought it was just text basically. maybe an icon would help?

also if it’s not a pain would be nice for that to show under the right click menu in the finder too I think even though it’s not something people change often, that was atleast the first place I looked

Yeah the link might need a pencil icon to make it more clear. And yeah I could see that in the finder menus too since it's something you set upon file creation and can still edit, thanks for the feedback!
